data.title: A Life in the Day: Guy Verhofstadt, the European Parliament’s lead Brexit negotiator
data.meta_description: Born in Dendermonde, Belgium, Verhofstadt, 64, studied law at the University of Ghent before becoming president of the Flemish PVV party at the age of 29. Known
data.text:
Born in Dendermonde, Belgium, Verhofstadt, 64, studied law at the University of Ghent before becoming president of the Flemish PVV party at the age of 29. Known as “Baby Thatcher” because of his free-market zeal, he moved to the political centre when he became prime minister of Belgium, a post he held from 1999 to 2008. As group leader for the Alliance of Liberals and Democrats, he joined the European parliament in 2009 and was appointed its lead Brexit negotiator last year. He has two children and lives in Ghent with his wife, Dominique Verkinderen, a professional opera singer.

I wake up at 7am and a cappuccino is a must. Breakfast is then Greek yoghurt, followed by bread with marmalade. I’m a fan of
